intro: Epidendrum brevivenium, commonly known as the short-stemmed epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and relatively short, sturdy stems. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, waxy texture. Epidendrum brevivenium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
